title: So masteries now have much more deeper specialization for every champion
body: And yet, we still have only 20 pages max, wth rito?

replies.body: It's also much, much easier to adjust a page. Rather than needing to reset a page, or pull a lot of points out, to swap stuff round, you can just click on the alternative to automatically swap points from one option in a tier to another. E.g. if you've got 18 points in Cunning and want to swap from one Tier 1 Keystone to the other one you don't have to pull all the subsequent points out of the tree, but can just toggle to the other Tier 1 Keystone with a click.

Yeah,it will be match easier to adjust masteries during champ select now.
Now if only we could do the same for Runes.

I also want to point out that some of the masteries in general were changed to have less overlap with similar masteries with different focuses. In particular, you can use near identical pages for laning and jungling now because all of the old jungling masteries that made it into the new system have effects that apply on monsters and either minions or champions, such as Savagery and Tough Skin.

I don't really wanna make a new thread about it so I am asking you here.

About the Cunning tree mastery Bandit. Right now on the client it lists that it grants gold by basic attacks+spells, while on patch notes it lists only basic attacks.

I've tested it in the game and spells definitely do not work. So no Maokai saplings giving gold or Shen's Vorpal Blade.

So probably just a tooltip discrepancy. Fix it?

eg: right now I was only playing once every 28 days to not decay. If my pages weren't named, I'd be fucked.

How about fix the problem instead of writing it off? Add more pages.
